result.execSummary:
David N Hand was found not guilty on all charges in this case. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David N Hand is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David N Hand in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for David N Hand.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

 9:59 AM    Jury brought in 

 9:59 AM    Court gives preliminary instructions
10:05 AM   Selected jury panel sworn by Clerk

10:05 AM   Opening statement by Atty Steiner
10:11 AM   Opening statement by Atty. Erickson

10:14 AM   1W - Angie Lortie - sworn by clerk 
                   exam. by Atty. Steiner
                             Exh #1 - M- O R  series of Photos of victim
                             Exh #2 - M- O R  series of Photos of room
10:39 AM    Atty. Steiner requests to publish Exh's 1& 2 to the jury - granted by Court (copies of exhibits provided to jury) Court allows jurors time to review photos
10:45 AM    continued exam of 1W by Atty. Steiner
10:50 AM              Exh #3 - M-O-R  Recording of 911 call  (only the audio file ending in extension .wav on drive is received)
10:55 AM   cross exam by Atty. Erickson 

11:05 AM   2W - David Langdon - Sworn by Clerk
11:09AM    exam by Atty. Steiner                  
                  witness identifies defendant - record reflects identification of defendant by 2W
                  no cross exam by Atty. Erickson
11:12 AM - the State rests its case
11:13 AM - jury taken out at this time

Court recesses for 15 min. at 11:14 AM - Reconvenes at 11:30 (outside the presence of the jury)
                  Atty. Erickson is heard 
                  Court addresses Def's constitutional right to testify/not to testify
                  Defendant states he has chosen to testify

11:32 AM   Jury brought in

11:33 AM   3W - David Hand - Sworn by Clerk
11:33 AM   exam. by Atty. Erickson
11:47 AM   cross exam by Atty. Steiner
11:49 Am   redirect by Atty. Erickson
11:50 AM   Evidence is closed
11:51 AM   Jury is excused at this time, to return at 1:00 PM

outside presence of jury
Court prints prop. jury instructions and provides copy to attorneys- advises counsel/staff that jury instructions will be addressed at 12:45 PM 
11:56 AM   Court recesses until 12:45 PM

12:46 PM   On the record - Jury instructions addressed, counsel agree to revisions (Def. not present). Court in recess 
12:59 PM   On the record - Court questions counsel re: jury instructions- counsel both agree to jury instructions in their final form  (Def. is present at this time)
  1:00 PM   Jury brought in 
  1:00 PM   Court reads jury instructions
  1:17 PM   Closing argument by Atty Steiner
  1:33 PM   Closing argument by Atty. Erickson
  1:45 PM   Final argument by Atty. Steiner              
                   
  1:51 PM   Court gives final instructions to jury
  1:54 PM   Bailiff's sworn
  1:55 PM   Jury taken out to begin deliberation

Counsel agree exhibits should only be given to jury if requested by them - Court will allow Exh's 1 & 2 to be given to the jury if requested.
Court inquires whether jury instructions should be changed to reflect eight (8) jury forms will be given to jury instead of four (4) - counsel agree and court so modifies the instructions. 
  1:59 PM   Court in recess
  2:01 PM   Bailiff notifies court the jury has a question (off record)
  2:09 PM   Court reads jury questions (on record outside the presence of jury) Jury requests all photos as 911 call
Court knows of no way to provide 911 call in jury room - already ruled previously they could have all photos. Will bring jury back in to listen to call again
  2:10 PM   Jury brought back into courtroom
  2:11 PM    911 call (Exh. #3) played for jury
  2:13 PM   Jury taken out to continue deliberation
  2:14 PM   Court in recess

  3:23 PM   Court notified that the jury has reached a verdict 
  
  3:30 PM  Jury is brought in
  3:30 PM  Case recalled
Court questions foreperson - 
Foreperson gives verdict forms to the Bailiff, bailiff provides them to Judge

Judge reads verdicts
Ct. 1 NOT GUILTY
Ct. 2 NOT GUILTY
Ct. 3 NOT GUILTY
Ct. 4 NOT GUILTY
No polling requested
3:33 PM   Jurors thanked and excused 

Judgment of Acquittal entered as to all four cts in 22CF04. based on verdicts of the jury.

Defendant shall have no abusive or violent contact with A.L. and defendant shall not discuss the pending case with A.L.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Atty Erickson is prepared to move forward.  Waives further formal reading, the defendant will stand mute, clerk will enter a not guilty plea as to each of the four counts.

Court will modify the bond with new conditions, the cash bond the def has already posted will remain the same. as to No abusive or violent contact with A.L. and def shall not discuss the pending case with A.L.
